entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 4:08PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels Continue on the Tanana River... The Tanana River continues to run near bankfull at some locations between Tok and Manley Hot Springs. Water levels on the Tanana River are expected to remain high through mid week. Expect many gravel bars to remain underwater, with increased debris moving downriver.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 4:08PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...More Heavy Rain in the Alaska Range... Another moisture laden weather system is moving across the Interior and Alaska Range with rainfall amounts of 0.50 to 1.0 inch expected today. Additional rainfall is expected through mid week with 1 to 2 inches of rainfall Tuesday into Wednesday. Heaviest rainfall will be south of Kantishna and Healy in Denali
entry.cap:areaDesc: Denali; Eastern Alaska Range
